oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Front hall of the Hermitage, circa 1930
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard featuring the front entry hall of the Hermitage, home of General Andrew Jackson, seventh President of the United States. The wallpaper represents the legend of the travels of Telemachus, a figure in Greek mythology, and was imported by Jackson in 1835. Also pictured is a circular staircase leading up to the second level. Forms part of the Norton Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845--Homes and haunts--Tennessee--Hermitage
